text: I went to Hawaii recently on vacation.
Make some noise if you've ever been to Hawaii.
Anybody?
I loved it.
I went to Hawaii on vacation. I'd never been.
I went down to the beach.
White sand beaches.
And you can swim with sea turtles.
Nobody told me that.
It was beautiful!  It was majestic!
I feel like.. I honestly feel like it kind of changed my life.
It's that beautiful.
But there was the only thing that ruined it;
was that the government in Hawaii,
anywhere that you could swim with sea turtles,
has had to put up signs. And those signs read simply,
"Please do not touch or ride the sea turtles."
First of all, I've never even considered it
till you mentioned it.
Second, you know those signs
probably used to just read,
"Please do not TOUCH the sea turtles."
Oh, and we made them get more specific!
Didn't we?
That seems like a second or third generation sign.
Like, "I don't know how much better we can phrase it."
Just some guy arguing with his wife on the beach like,
"No, Camille, if God didn't want us to ride 'em
why did he build
those sweet saddles on their backs then?
Yeah, checkmate!
I'mma be a sea cowboy
and you can't stop me this time!"
My favorite thing about those signs:
people from all over the world vacation in Hawaii.
It is an international tourist destination.
But those signs, only written in English.
Oh yeah, Provo, that's just an American problem.
Maybe us and like three confused rude Canadians.
But that's it.
We're the only people on earth
that would go down to the beach on vacation,
look at endangered animal in the face and go, "Hey!
I'm gonna ride the heck out of you."
"Oh yeah."
Just tame 'em. Just like,
"Ssh-ssh-ssh-ssh-ssh-ssh-ssh
I'm gonna tame you."
You also know why I think
that's an American problem?
Want to hear the rest of the joke?
Click the play button to continue watching.
